evidence.source_document: Opposition to Application to Stay the Judgment of the United States District Court for the District of Maryland
evidence.text: the district court held that the Commissioners were entitled to relief, id. at 23a. As to the form of relief, the district court found declaratory relief 'appropriate' to 'clarify and settle the parties' legal relationships.' Id. at 24a. The court also enjoined Secretary Bessent, Director Vought, and Acting Chairman Feldman from effectuating the unlawful terminations

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs have a non-statutory right of action to enjoin and declare unlawful official action that is ultra vires and in excess of legal authority. ... Plaintiffs are entitled to declaratory relief against all Defendants and to injunctive relief against Defendants Bessent, Vought, and Feldman.
